Article: washington the united states placed five chinese companies on its sanctions blacklist thursday for supplying components to iran drone builders the us treasury indirectly tied the chinese companies to russian attacks in ukraine and iranian attacks on oil tankers in the gulf region in both cases using shahed 136 unmanned aerial vehicles made by the iran aircraft manufacturing industrial co hesa the sanctioned companies include chinese companies in hangzhou shenzhen guilin and hong kong which the treasury said shipped light engines and other drone components to hesa which is controlled by irandefense ministry according to the treasury the companies are responsible for the sale and shipment of thousands of aerospace components including components that can be used for uav applications to hesa the treasury said instatement iran is directly implicated in the ukrainian civilian casualties that result from russiause of iranian uavs in ukraine said treasury under secretary brian nelson inseparate sanctions action the treasury placed 39 firms and entities in iran hong kong china dubai and elsewhere on its blacklist for helping iran sell petrochemicals internationally in violation of sanctions on tehran us sanctions aiming at blocking those listed from accessing international markets and financial services by freezing their assets under us jurisdiction and forbidding any us

Title: under 23 world champ aman sehrawat qualifies for asian championships in place of injured ravi dahiya
Article: with top indian freestyle wrestlers bajrang punia and ravi dahiya missing out on the national selection trials for the asian wrestling championships on friday due to injury the spotlight fell on some of the promising youngsters who will be shouldering indian hopes aman sehrawat who became the first indian to wingold medal at the23 world championship last year is one such youngster the 18 year old is in good form after picking up the bronze medal at the recent zagreb ranking series event in dahiya57kg category in which he wontokyo silver sehrawat impressed from the off after winningcomfortable first bout he overturned0 4 deficit against atish todkar of maharashtra to prevail 14 4 showing good touch in an impressive showing the surprise of the day came in the 70kg category where mulayam yadav of uttar pradesh another junior world championship medallist defeated 2022 commonwealth games gold medallist naveen malik 7 4 among the promising crop of wrestlers that missed out were sagar jaglan and sujeet the latter missed out to fellow haryana wrestler anuj kumar in the 65kg category while sagar was eliminated in the final playoff round of the 74kg category by delhiyash tushir who booked his flight to astana where the event will be held between april 7 to 15 by winning 8 3 yash won the gold at the 2022 national games while sagar is the wrestling nationals champion the event was initially meant to be held in new delhi but governing body united world wrestling uww moved it out of the country after the sports ministry appointed an oversight committee in charge of the day to day operations of the sport after allegations of sexual harassment and intimidation were levelled against wrestling federation of india wfi president brij bhushan singh punia and dahiya who missed out due towrist and knee injury respectively were members of the group of wrestlers that protested against brij bhushan in delhi in january advertisement the oversight committee chaired by former boxer mary kom which also has the presence of wrestlers babita phogat and yogeshwar dutt hosted the selection trials one of those in protesting contingent deepak puniaformer world championship silver medallist comfortably sealed his place in the 92kg category of the asian event 2022 cwg bronze medallist deepak nehra also made the cut in the 97kg category the selection trials for women wrestlers will be held in new delhi on saturday qualified wrestlers for asianships freestyle advertisement 57kg aman sehrawat 61kg pankaj 65kg anuj kumar 70kg mulayam yadav 74kg yash tushir 79kg deepak 86kg jonty kumar 92kg deepak punia 97kg deepak nehra 125kg anirudh greco roman 55kg rupin 60kg sumit 63kg neeraj 67kg ashu 72kg vikas 77kg sajan 82kg rohit dahiya 87kg sunil kumar 97kg narender cheema 130kg naveen

Title: uttarakhand to open orphan only hostels
Article: dehradun to promote the integration of orphans with mainstream children 850 plus identified orphans will be admitted in 13 hostels exclusively made for them the hostels would cater the educational health and moral needs of these children who do not have any guardian to look after them in the crucial growing age the announcement was made by cm pushkar singh dhami during the jan aushadhi diwas celebration in dehradun at the event he assured the residents that across all the medical colleges cardiac catheterization laboratory and adequate mri and ct scan facilities in district hospitals along with technicians will be deployed

Title: us intel china communist party biggest threat to national security
Article: washington chinese communist party ccp represents both the leading and most consequential threat to us national security and leadership globallytop american intelligence official told lawmakers on wednesday as senators called for taking urgent steps to address the growing chinese challenge ccp represents both the leading and most consequential threat to us national security and leadership globally and its intelligence specific ambitions and capabilities make it for us our most serious intelligence rival avril haines director of the office of the director of national intelligence told members of the senate select committee on intelligence the threat has been complicated bydeepening collaboration with russia needless to say china which is increasingly challenging us economically technologically politically and militarily around the world remains our unparalleled priority she said adding china under president xi jinping will continue efforts to achieve his vision of making china the preeminent power in east asia andmajor power on the world stage

Title: world athletics pledges to have 40 per cent female representation in its council and woman vice president this year
Article: world athletics on wednesday pledged to have 40 per cent female representation in its council the all powerful decision making body andwoman vice president this year insignificant step towards gender equity in the sport innumber of initiatives announced on the occasion of the international womenday the world athletics governing body also committed itself to the extension of its ukraine solidarity fund to enable ukrainian athletes majority of them female to participate in world athletics championships and other events this year increase the number of women on the world athletics council from eight members currently tominimum of 10 members including at least one female vice president at the council elections in august 2023 women will represent 40 of the world athletics council world athletics said inrelease buildpipeline to increase to 50 the female representation across our four commissions for the 2023 2027 term in order to provide more opportunities for female administrators with aspirations to run for our council in 2027 wa also aims to increase the number of female coaches at the world championships to at least 20 by the 2025 edition in tokyo by encouraging member federations to send more female coaches and providing the learning pathway in countries where women are under represented at the coaching level to help us achieve this our gender leadership taskforce is working with the ioc female coaching leadership programme wish to enable eligible female coaches to be selected as part of their national team for the paris 2024 olympic gamestotal of eight candidates from athletics have been selected for the programme each of the new pledge was aimed at improving gender equity in athletics and closing the gender gap in the sport in the third year of the campaign the world body said launched on international womenday 2021 with the ambition of making substantial gains in eliminating gender bias in athletics this campaign has already made notable strides in fulfilling or initiating all of the pledges we have made in the last 24 months it said world athletics president sebastian coe said in order to achieve true equity in our sport it is important that we offer our female athletes administrators and officials the tools and environment they need to be empowered to pursue careers at all levels of athletics be it by setting quotas for female representation on our council or providing more flexible learning and development opportunities that better suit womencommitments we are absolutely dedicated to making our sport equitable and representative for all he urged all the stakeholders to take an active role in order to achieve the collective goals regarding equity for women in athletics sport and every aspect of life advertisement in addition to the new pledges world athletics said it was making an additional pledge to support female ukrainian athletesyear after the outbreak of war in their country last year through the establishment of our ukraine solidarity fund we supported over 100 ukrainian athletes along with their immediate family members and entourage including coaches and technical officials to train qualify and participate in world athletics championships events female athletes made up 70 of athlete we pledge to repeat the world athletics ukraine solidarity fund to support ukrainian athlete attendance in budapest and other world athletics championships events

Title: afghanistan un afghanistan is worldmost repressive country for women
Article: islamabad since the taliban takeover of afghanistan the country has become the most repressive in the world for women and girls deprived of many of their basic rights the united nations said wednesday instatement released on the international womenday the un mission said that afghanistannew rulers have shown an almost singular focus on imposing rules that leave most women and girls effectively trapped in their homes they have banned girls education beyond sixth grade and women from public spaces such as parks and gyms women are also barred from working at national and international nongovernmental organisations and ordered to cover themselves from head to toe afghanistan under the taliban remains the most repressive country in the world regarding womenrights said roza otunbayeva special representative of the un secretary general and head of the mission to afghanistan it has been distressing to witness their methodical deliberate and systematic efforts to push afghan women and girls out of the public sphere she added

Title: retired canadian olympians call for russian belarusian exclusion at paris 2024
Article: a group of 42 retired canadian olympians have urged the canadian olympic committee coc to reverse its support for russian and belarusian participation at next yearparis games unless russia withdraws from ukraine the international olympic committee ioc set outpath in january for those athletes who were banned from many international competitions after russiafeb 24 invasion of ukraine last year to compete without their flags and anthems many countries have publicly opposed the iocproposal and ukraine has threatened to boycott the paris olympics as long as moscowtroops remain in ukraine which belarus helped facilitate the coc has said it supports the iocrecommendation that russia and belarus should be barred from international competitions but added it is open to exploring how athletes from the two countries could compete as neutrals in paris we condemn the recent public statements issued by the coc supporting the exploration ofpathway for russian and belarusian athletes to compete as neutrals in the 2024 paris olympics the athletes wrote inletter on wednesday opening the door to neutral russian and belarusian participation sendsmessage that the coc is no longer concerned with russiabrutal invasion of ukraine no pathway should be considered for russian or belarusian athletes to compete in the olympic games until russia fully withdraws from ukraine reuters has reached out to the coc for comment advertisement canada was among 35 countries that releasedjoint statement in february calling on the ioc to clarify the definition of neutrality and pledging their support for banning russians and belarusians from international competitions coc chief executive david shoemaker told cbc sports last month athletes from the two counties should publicly speak out against the war to attain the neutral status they would require to compete recent remarks by coc officials endorsing conditions for neutrality are unfounded and out of touch the letter added for example it is illegal in russia to publicly denounce military actions abroad advertisement refusing their participation in international sport is not simplymatter of denying athleteschance to compete because of their passport it isrejection of an unlawful and inhumane war andrecognition of the role international sport plays in geopolitics canadian greats and olympic gold medallists were among the signatories which included ice dancer tessa virtue hockey player hayley wickenheiser cross country skier beckie scott and freestyle skier alex bilodeau

Title: man dies at police commissionerate
Article: hyderabad61 year old man who had taken upcontract at hyderabad police commissionerate banjara hills road no 12 died aftermetal fence fell on him on tuesday his contract was for erecting the huge fence to avoid unknown persons from entering police said that the metal fence was nearly 12 feet and the incident took place when it was being set up he was shifted tonearby hospital where he died tnn

Title: twitter blue what eu regulator has to say on elon musk launching twitter blue in europe
Article: no inquiry launched countries where twitter blue is officially available elon musk launched paid twitter blue subscription in december purportedly as one of the ways to cut losses the company incurred after advertisers paused spending on the platform it was initially launched inhandful of markets and in the last three months saw the subscription model expand to multiple regions recently twitter announced its availability to more countries in europe in the latest development the lead privacy regulator in the region has raised concerns about the rollout according toreport by news agency reuters irelanddata protection commissioner helen dixon said that she was concerned that the company launched its twitter blue subscription service in the region without consulting her office despite pledging to do so she said the service raised privacy concerns around the verification of accounts to prevent users from posing as public figures we relittle bit more concerned this week now that we see that the blue tick subscription service is rolling out here in eu countries having been reassured that it wasngoing to roll out in the european union eu and certainly not before there have been discussions with our office dixon was quoted as saying dixon said no formal inquiry has been launched but we re atheightened state of contact with twitter she also said consultation prior to launchingproduct or service in the region is the best practice she noted that twitter now hasvery strong data protection officer but beyond the data protection office there are clearly other forces at play and we need to understandlittle bit more about those dixon added twitter expanded twitter blue paid subscription to 20 more countries earlier this month it is now available in 37 countries including the us the uk canada australia new zealand japan brazil indonesia india saudi arabia france germany spain italy portugal netherlands poland ireland belgium sweden romania czech republic finland denmark greece austria hungary bulgaria lithuania slovakia latvia slovenia estonia croatia luxembourg malta and cyprus twitter blue is available in india at the price of rs 900 per month on android ios and rs 650 per month on the web

Title: in karapur cashew plantations gutted
Article: bicholim the fire that broke out at cashew plantation in karapur in bicholim taluka on tuesday afternoon has resulted in major losses for the plantation owners the cause of the fire is yet to be determined the fire broke out in kudupwada and spread to the surrounding areas gutting cashew plants dry grass aggravated the situtation the flames spread to the vicinity of the dnyanjyoti high school in gawandiwada but timely action by firefighters averted disaster tnn

Title: icra domestic flyer traffic to hit 14 5cr in 12 months icra
Article: mumbai domestic airlines passenger traffic is estimated to grow at 8 13 in the 12 months from april to touch 145 150 million 14 5 crore to 15 crore which is much higher than the pre covid levels said credit rating agency icra in its recent report adding the indian aviation industry is gradually moving out of its turbulent phase given the fast paced recovery in domestic passenger traffic in the past 12 months of the 2023 financial year icra said it has revised its outlook for the indian aviation industry from negative to stable the industrynet loss is expected to decline significantly to rs 50 70 billion in fy2024 from an estimated rs 110 130 billion in fy2023 it added the industry has witnessed improved pricing power as reflected in the healthier yields the same is expected to continue given the sequential decline in aviation turbine fuel atf prices from the peak of june 2022 and the anticipation of relatively stable foreign exchange rates it said in the current fiscal domestic passenger traffic at 111 million witnessed an increase of 66 2 and trailed the pre covid levels by only about 8 3 international passenger traffic for indian carriers is ongrowth trajectory as well with estimated year on year growth of 10 15 between april 2023 and march 2024 post the 125 130 expansion between april 2022 and march 2023 the international passenger traffic for indian carriers is likely to surpass the pre covid levels in fy2023 itself while exceeding the peak of fy2019 in fy2024 over the medium term growth in the indian airline sector will be driven by improving airport infrastructure in addition to the governmentconcerted efforts to promote regional tourism it said the competitive landscape in the domestic aviation industry is set to change with the foray of new entrants likely re initiation of operations by jet airways and consolidation of air india air asia india and vistara it said adding that capacity addition in fy2023 will be limited to around 10 of the fy2022 fleet of airlines which was close to around about 700 aircraft

Title: mstalin interacts with guest workers asks them not believe in rumours
Article: madurai tamil nadu chief ministerk stalin interacted with guest workers from bihar jharkhand and west bengal employed ingloves manufacturing unit situated in tirunelvelikavalkinaru on tuesday among the 450 workers employed in the unit 150 are guest workers including 30 women from these states stalin interacted with them mainly in tamil most workers he interacted with spoke tamil he interacted withfew of them in english as well stalin asked them if they were facing any hurdles working in tamil nadu and how many years they had been working in the state he also asked them how the local people were interacting with them and if they were treated well in the state the workers said some of them had been working there for the last six years and most of them had been for almost two years many of them had brought their families from their native places they told the chief minister that local people maintainedfriendly relationship with them and they felt very safe in tamil nadu the guest workers said that the company where they were working provided them good food accommodation and other amenities he requested the guest workers not to believe in rumours and assured them that the tamil nadu government was providingsafe working atmosphere to all the workers ministersn nehruksramachandran and mano thangaraj kanam latex industries director pravin mathew and others were present during the visit

Title: dams donrelease water risk ecology
Article: kullu the non release of 15 to 20 mandatory minimum water from many dams in himachal pradesh has made the environmentalists worried the national green tribunal ngt wants the volume to be released but pandoh and barot in mandi district donfollow these orders despite ecological damage devbhumi paryavaran rakshak manch chairman narendar saini who has written to the state government for implementation of the ngtorders said pandoh and barot havenbeen releasing water for two months pandoh still pushes some volume into the beas river while barot has stopped feeding the uhl the rivers winter water flow has dipped below minimum impacting aquatic life and irrigation schemes the drying up of the rivers has caused many fish species to disappear many water schemes linked to the rivers have also run dry while the dams refuse to open their gates despite repeated demand from the locals amid two months of deficient rainfall that has startedwater crisis the plan to install real time online continuous flow measuring devices at these two dams hasnprogressed in 2017 the ngt had issued orders that all rivers in the country must maintain 15 to 20 of the average lean seasonflow itnot the first time that the environmentalists have pointed out the non release of minimum water from the dams into the rivers downstream acting onpublic interest petition filed last may the himachal pradesh high court had issuednotice to the state government regarding the non release of water from the dams at pandoh and barot

Title: ioa panel probing sexual abuse allegations against wfi chief will submit report soon usha
Article: the committee formed by the indian olympic association to probe sexual abuse allegations against sidelined wfi chief brij bhushan sharan singh is yet to submit its report and ioa presidentt usha said it is taking time since it issensitive issue the ioa had on january 20 formedseven member committee headed by the legendary boxer mc mary kom to investigate the allegations of sexual harassment against the wfi president by some of the countrytop wrestlers advertisement it report is not finalised it is going on we have met the players wrestlers the ioa committee will finalise and give the report to the ioa later usha told pti after presiding over the annual general meeting agm of the ioa here on saturday it issensitive issue and it has to be done ingood way very soon we will do that she said when asked if there is any deadline for submitting the report it happened when just after we took charge it was with ministry earlier both the ministry and ioa have constituted committees the ioa panel was formed after the agitating wrestlers including the likes of bajrang punia sakshi malik vinesh phogat deepak punia and ravi dahiya had demanded the formation of an enquiry committee to probe the allegations against singh the government had formed an oversight committee also under mary kom to probe the charges levelled by the wrestlers singh had appeared before the oversight committee of the government on february 28 and had outrightly rejected all the charges the ioa agm the first after usha took charge in december last year also decided to stage the 37th national games in goa towards the end of october or early part of november the ioa wants prime minister narendra modi to inaugurate the games and the dates of the multi sport event could be fixed depending on his availability we are going to organise the national games in goa and 90 per cent of work is already completed there said usha the sprint queen of the 1980s the dates are not yet fixed it can be from october end to november 12 like that she added we want the prime minister to inaugurate the national games according to the time of his availability we are going to fix the dates of the games the goa government has expressed its readiness to host the games after multiple delays due to infrastructure related issues some officials of the ioa want the national games to end before diwali which falls on november 12 earlier last month officials of the state government including the sports minister had met usha and the ioa top brass on the matter recently the games technical conduct committee gtcc of the ioa under the chairmanship of its executive council member amitabh sharma made an inspection and declared that goa is ready for the national games thirty seven sports disciplines have been approved andfew more traditional games may also be included later on goa was to host the 36th edition of the national games in 2016 but it did not happen due to multiple delays mainly relating to construction of infrastructure gujarat then hosted the event in september october last year on the issue of the appointment of the chief executive officer of the ioa usha said we have called for applications we had norms criteria but only one application is upto the mark we need more applications so we are going to advertise for the post again ioa joint secretary and all india football federation president kalyan chaubey has been discharging the functions of the ceo so far under the new constitution drafted bysupreme court constituted panel and approved by the international olympic committee the ioa was to appointceo who would perform the functions of the erstwhile secretary general the ceo will be an ex officio member of the executive council without voting rights the ioa had earlier called for applications for the post to be submitted on january 31 at the latest one of the eligibility criteria for the said post is that the candidate should bemanagement professional with an experience of no less than 10 years as the ceo ofcompany entity with an annual turnover of no less than rs 25 crores article 15 3 of the amended ioa constitution also says that the ceo shall be proposed bynomination committee comprising the ioa president chairman of the athletes commission and one ioc member from india except for the headline this story has not been edited by the telegraph online staff and has been published fromsyndicated feed

Title: himachal pradesh cm sukhvinder sukhu reaches assembly in old alto car to attend his maiden budget session
Article: shimla himachal pradesh chief minister sukhvinder singh sukhu left the people surprised on tuesday morning by reaching the assembly premises in his old maruti alto car to attend his maiden budget session when being asked by the media the cm said that he used his car after becoming mla for the first time and he was using this car to visit vidhan sabha since then as an mla it reminds me of my old days he said education minister rohit thakur and lahaul spiti mla ravi thakur also accompanied him in the car cm sukhu known for his simplicity is often seen on morning walks at the mall road in shimla and even meets people without any vvip protocol on some occasions he is also spotted eating food at small dhabas at the assembly premises the chief minister was welcomed by his deputy mukesh agnihotri and parliamentary affairs minister harshwardhan chauhan

Title: karni sena founder lokendra singh kalvi dies in rajasthan
Article: family sources said he sufferedcardiac arrest late in the night and breathed his last kalvi was admitted to the sawai man singh hospital for the past few days rajput leader and karni sena founder lokendra singh kalvi passed away atstate run hospital in jaipur on tuesday march 14 family sources said he sufferedcardiac arrest late in the night and breathed his last kalvi was admitted to the sawai man singh hospital for the past few days rajput karni sena founder lokendra singh kalvi passed away last night at jaipursawai man singh sms hospital he was undergoing treatment in the hospital since june 2022 after suffering frombrain stroke dr achal sharma superintendent sms hospital file pic pic twitter com x9gogqt3ho ani mp cg rajasthan march 14 2023 his funeral will be held at his ancestral village in nagaur districtkalvi village later in the day the sources added advertisement also read change title or face ire karni sena threatens akshay kumarprithviraj the son of former union minister kalyan singh kalvi lokendra singh kalvi was the patron of shree rajput karni sena which had led the 2018 protests against sanjay leela bhansalifilm padmaavat for alleged distortion of historical facts he had also beennational level basketball player with inputs from agencies

Title: singh babu invitational prize money hockey tournament inaugural matches in babu hockey meet end indraw
Article: lucknow the inaugural match of the 40th all india kd singh babu invitational prize money hockey tournament played between hfb hockey society sonepat and karampur xi at mini stadium here on monday ended in5 5 draw naveen chetri of hfb convertedpenalty stroke into goal at the 12th minute of the match the second and third goals for the hfb were scored by neeraj kumar and shubham pasi karampursajal saxena amit yadav and gagan rajbhar scoredgoal each taking the tally to 3 3 at the 41st minute neeraj once again scoredfield goal givinglead of one goal to his team but amit yadav of karampur successfully converted two penalty corners at 45th and 49th minute taking the score to 5 4 however in the dying minutes of the game aakash yadav of hfb scoredfield goal and the match ended indraw the second match played between combined hostel up and sai lucknow also ended in1 1 draw earlier the tournament was inaugurated by director sports rp singh olympians sujeet kumar and syed ali and others attended the inaugural function on tuesday the air force will take on cisf

Title: oc conducts controversy free wrestling selection trial but uncertainty remains over future role
Article: alongside the eponymous death and taxes thereanother certainty of life at least in indian sports you canconductwrestling competition in india withoutmeasure of controversy contentious refereeing headstrong strong men wrestlers and coaches andunilateral decision making federation boss always made forcombustible combination something similar was still expected after the functioning of the wrestling federation of india wfi was suspended last month following unprecedented allegations of wrongdoing financial and otherwise made by top wrestlers against officials and three term president brij bhushan sharan singh and replaced instead with an oversight committee appointed by the ministry of sports the selection trials for the asian championships were the first major competition conducted by the six member committee headed by olympic bronze medalist boxer mc mary kom trouble began two days before the start of the trials when on the 6 th of march five wrestlers approached the courts seeking their inclusion in the tryouts while the protesting wrestlers were duly inducted there was still plenty of tension in the air heading into it police were deployed and spectators were kept tominimum athletes were only permitted to bring in two support staff even the media was discouraged on the first day to keep the number of non athletes and potential troublemakers down tominimum there was plenty of potential for that even the very specific venn diagram of selection trials held at new delhiindira gandhi stadium would throw uppolice complaint after supporters of one wrestler thrashed his opponent after an ill tempered contest in 2018 nevertheless for all their efforts the inevitable happened aftercontentious final second four point throw awarded to sagar won himmatch against sachin sehrawat in the men67kg greco roman category angry coaches of the latter stormed the mat accusations were made suggesting certain judges might have hadbias matters were not helped even afterreview due to inconclusive footage in the past wfi president brij bhushan who hadreputation for wielding the microphone and raining down instructions would have tried to makeunilateral decision and likely inflamed matters worse something similar happened at the commonwealth games selection trials last year also at the ig stadium whenproblematic decision in the menheavyweight category ended up withreferee slapped andwrestler suspended this time though the oversight committee represented on the day by captain retd rajagopalan former sai executive director and former olympic bronze medallist wrestler yogeshwar dutt cooled matters down by simply going by the book and referring the matter tounited world wrestling uww panel for precisely such situations the result came in half an hour later in favour of sagar and with the final decision being made by an international neutral body the protest too died away later on captain rajagopalan would suggest exactly how the situation had been handled we studied the uww rules of how the tournaments are organised once we knew there wasprecedent to handle suchsituation we went by that he suggested indeed but for the legal challenge prior to the tournament with players the selection trials largely passed off without incident unlike in the past bouts were not stopped midway for officials to pose for pictures with players there were no long stoppages of play due to coaches or wrestlers protests and there were no threats of violence from officials or competitorsfew of the senior athletes bajrang punia vinesh phogat and sakshi malik who had led the protests at jantar mantar which led to the initial suspension in the functioning of the federation didncompete at the selection trials but the others barring injury did compete in new delhi what the trials suggested is that it is indeed possible to conductlargely controversy free wrestling event it remains to be seen though what the future would bring the oversight committee is expected to present their fact finding report on the issues raised by the protesting wrestlers some time next week however it is uncertain when the sports ministry would act on the findings and what the role of the oversight committee would be in the functioning of the federation until then despitesuccessful trial not all members of the committee are looking forward to the continued responsibility the oversight committee was expected to deliver its fact finding report on the 23rd of february and that date was subsequently pushed back by another couple of weeks which have now passed we will have to continue being responsible for the day to day affairs of the wrestling federation of india until we are told to stop by the ministry of sport itnot something that is ideal because all of us have our regular jobs work is piling up there as well but this isresponsibility we have been given saidmember of the committee

Title: all england open prannoy lakshya sen advance
Article: indiabadminton star lakshya sen defeated world no 5 chou tien chen in his first round mensingles match while hs prannoy beat chinese taipeiworld no 24 wang tzu wei in his opening encounter at the all england open 2023 badminton championships in birmingham on tuesday according to information received here prannoy who won 21 19 22 20 in49 minute opening round clash will meet third seeded indonesian anthony sinisuka ginting in the round of 16 lakshya sen who made the all england final last year started slowly but overcame the world no 5 chou tien chen also from chinese taipei by21 18 21 19 scoreline lakshya sen will either face the winner of the all danish tie between anders antonsen or rasmus gemke in the next round on wednesday world no 22 kidambi srikanth who is yet to winsingle match on the bwf world tour 2023 so far will take on franceworld no 25 toma popov in round 1 of mensingles world no 9 pv sindhu will open her womensingles campaign against chinaworld no 17 zhang yi man

Title: high jump legend dick fosbury dies at 76
Article: olympic high jump champion dick fosbury who revolutionised the event withradically different jumping technique that was eventually named after him died on sunday aged 76 his agent ray schulte said on monday fosbury won gold in the high jump at the 1968 olympic games in mexico city where he jumped back first to clear the bartechnique that has since been named the fosbury flop and used by all high jumpers today it is withheavy heart thatmust announce that longtime friend and client dick fosbury passed away peacefully in his sleep early sunday morning afterbrief recurrence of lymphoma schulte wrote on instagram the track and field legend is survived by his wife robin tomasi son erich fosbury and stepdaughters stephanie thomas phipps and kristin thompson the straddle or scissor jump were common techniques in the high jump but when foam matting was introduced to break the athletes fall fosbury used his new technique for the first time on the world stage the american setthen olympic record of 2 24 metres to take the gold and change the sport forever with more and more athletes attempting the back first jump as the technique gradually gained acceptance dick fosbury was always true to the olympic values and served the olympic movement innumber of functions including as president of world olympians he will forever be remembered as an outstanding olympic champion international olympic committee president thomas bach said with his groundbreaking fosbury flop technique dick fosbury not only won olympic gold at mexico city 1968 but also revolutionized the high jump he was truly an olympic pioneer and legend team usa posted on twitteram deeply saddened by the passing of dick fosburytrue legend and pioneer in the world of track and field dickinnovative technique of the fosbury flop revolutionised the high jump event and forever changed the sport said max siegel ceo of usa track fieldhad the privilege of seeing first hand how dick tirelessly advocated for the well being of athletes particularly retired athletes said michael conley usatf board chair and high performance division chair world athletics said instatement fosburyinnovation took the high jump to another level and he remained involved in athletics throughout his life sharing his knowledge and skill with future generations he leavesremarkable legacy dick fosbury had revolutionised the practice of this sport with his sublime audacity thoughts to his loved ones said amelie oudea castera franceminister of sports and the olympic and paralympic games fosburygold and his contribution to the sport also earned himspot in the national track and field hall of fame

Title: delhi hc asks boxing federation forresponse on the past performance of selected boxers for womenworld boxing championships
Article: the delhi high court on monday sought boxing federation of indiabfi response on the past performance of certain boxers selected for the womenworld boxing championships to take place in the national capital between march 15 31single judge bench of justice prathiba singh was hearingplea by three boxers manju rani shiksha narwal and poonam poonia who after not making it to the national team for the championship moved the high court seeking its intervention for their inclusion the counsel for the three boxers said that between 2018 2022 their performance was better than some of those selected for the tournament who hardly won any medals justice singh observed that while the court cannot get into the merit of selection the difference in the performance of some of the players was quite stark the hc further asked bficounsel to seek instructions on the issue the boxercounsel argued that player selection should happen on the basis of meritorious past performances and the three boxers should be selected bficounsel said that the names of selected players have already been sent to the concerned authorities the matter is next listed on march 14 on march 7 the hc had asked bfi to submit the evaluation forms of the three boxers which was submitted before the hc bfi had previously argued that players had been evaluated and their candidature had been rejected it was argued earlier that players are evaluated at the national camp on the basis of selection criteria for national camps and world championships while the hc had previously refused to grant interim relief to the boxers it had said that if in the meantime ifreserved category player is being maintained by the respondent then the petitioner boxers can be considered for the same it was previously argued by the boxers that the players who made it to the national team were those who had been defeated by the petitioner boxers at the national championship in bhopal last december the plea states that the petitioners had requested the relevant authorities to consider their names for selection in the womenworld championship but they did not get any fruitful results

Title: pence pence says trump endangered my family on january 6
Article: washington former vice president mike pence on saturday harshly criticised former president donald trump for his role in the january 6 riot at the us capitol widening the rift between the two men as they prepare to battle over the republican nomination in next yearelection president trump was wrong pence said during remarks at the annual white tie gridiron dinner attended by politicians and journalistshad no right to overturn the election and his reckless words endangered my family and everyone at the capitol that day andknow history will hold donald trump accountable penceremarks were the sharpest condemnation yet from the once loyal lieutenant who has often shied away from confronting his former boss trump has already declared his candidacy pence has not but hebeen laying the groundwork to run in the days leading up to january 6 2021 trump pressured pence to overturn president joe bidenelection victory as he presided over the ceremonial certification of the results pence refused and when rioters stormed the capitol some chanted that they wanted to hang mike pence the house committee that investigated the attack said in its final report that the president of the united states had riled upmob that hunted his own vice president with his remarks pence solidified his place inbroader debate within the republican party over how to view the attack house speaker kevin mccarthy for example recently provided tucker carlson with an archive of security camera footage from january 6 which the fox news host has used to downplay the dayevents and promote conspiracy theories make no mistake about it what happened that day wasdisgrace pence said in his gridiron dinner remarks and it mocks decency to portray it any other way trump meanwhile has continued to spread lies about his election loss heeven spoken in support of the rioters and said he would consider pardoning them if he was reelected speeches at the gridiron dinner are usually humorous affairs where politicians poke fun at each other and pence did plenty of that as well he joked that trumpego was so fragile he wanted his vice president to sing wind beneath my wings one of the lines is did you ever know that you re my hero during their weekly lunches he took another shot at trump over classified documentsread that some of those classified documents they found at marlago were actually stuck in the presidentbible pence said which proves he had absolutely no idea they were there even before the dinner was over pence was facing criticism for his jokes about transportation secretary buttigieg the first openly gay cabinet member ins history pence mentioned that despite travel problems that were plaguing americans buttigieg took maternity leave after he and his husband adopted newborn twins pete is the only person in human history to havechild and everyone else gets post partum depression pence said

Title: aap government passing water crisis blame on to haryana bjp
Article: new delhi the bjp on sunday said that water shortage was increasing in delhi because of the mismanagement by the aap government which was busy passing the blame on to the haryana government delhi bjp working president virendra sachdeva said in the last one decade the people of delhi have been facing the problem of irregular and dirty water but the aap government only passes the buck by blaming the haryana government despite the bjprepeated demands the kejriwal government never called an all party meeting on delhiwater crisis he said the government had shirked its responsibility by making political statements he said sachdeva said the kejriwal government had failed to provide water to the people of delhi as per their requirement despite gettingfixed amount of water from haryana and uttar pradesh the delhi government should immediately get wazirabad and sonia vihar water reservoirs cleaned and bring outsummer action plan for water supply he said the bjpattack on aap comes in the backdrop of lg vk saxenaletter on saturday to cm arvind kejriwal alleging the delhi jal boardfailure to desiltreservoir that supplies water to wazirabad and chandrawal treatment plants water minister saurabh bhardwaj had hit back and asked the lg to take cognisance of illegal sand mining in haryana that was responsible for the crisis

Title: bjp demands apology over rahul gandhilondon speech lok sabha adjourned till 2 pm
Article: even as the opposition was armed with allegations of misusing central investigative agencies against its leaders the ruling bjp on monday disrupted proceedings in the lok sabha seeking an apology from congress mp rahul gandhi for his remarks against indian democracy outside the country the second leg of the parliamentbudget session kicked off on monday but soon after speaker om birla later adjourned the house till 2 pm defence minister rajnath singh led the treasury benches offensive against gandhi who has criticised the government for putting democracy under attack and said he has sought the intervention of foreign powers to come and save indian democracy this is condemnable the house should condemn and he should apologise to the lok sabha singh was speaking amid sloganeering from the opposition as well as the ruling party members on separate issues barring the trinamool congress tmc the opposition protested with its members coming to the well of the house shouting slogans against the government this included members of the congress dravida munnetra kazhagam dmk nationalist congress party ncp the left and bharat rashtra samithi brs even before the opposition started its protests over the multiple arrests and questioning of its leaders by central investigative agencies bjp mps raised the slogan rahul gandhi desh ko badnam karna bandh karo rahul gandhi stop defaming the nation singh got up and said gandhi had raised questions on indian democracy on foreign soil parliamentary affairs minister pralhad joshi said india is the mother of democracy rahul gandhi who ismember of this house cast aspersions on the chair saying his mic was turned off he was allowed to make his entire speech but still he blamed the chair when the fundamental rights of citizens were suspended during the emergency where was democracy when an ordinance promulgated bygovernment in which manmohan singh was the prime minister and leaders like sharad pawar were ministers was torn publicly calling it nonsense making the pm helpless where was democracy he asked speaker om birla appealed to both sides to remain seated so that the question hour could be taken up with both sides refusing to relent birla adjourned the proceedings till 2 pm before the house met union ministers piyush goyal and anurag thakur along with joshi issuedstatement seeking an apology from rahul gandhi for his remarks in london

Title: vhp vhp to connect with masses to celebrate ram mahotsav
Article: prayagraj the vishwa hindu parishad kashi prant leadership are connecting with masses through both online and offline mode to celebrate ram mahotsav programmes across the 17 districts of kashi prant between march 22 and april 6 on the occasion of hindu new year the vhp leaders have roped in its all units including village samiti and engaged prant vibhag and district level workers to make the eventgrand success vhp leaders have also asked their senior office bearers to attend at least five programmes to be organised during the event office bearers have also been asked to chalk out plans and strategies and connect with masses senior vhp leader lal mani tiwari told toi senior vhp functionaries are busy in chalking out plans and strategies to make ram mahotsavgrand success hectic preparations are underway to celebrate ram mahotsav across the kashi prant with full pomp and show groups of volunteers would be conducting door to door campaign in around 5 000 villages of kashi prant and installing saffron flags with om written on them during the event besidesseries of religious processions and keertan events would also be organised tiwari also claimed that vhp has started working on formation of tolis across the state and these tolis are being formed at village levels senior vhp functionaries would also be reviewing the preparations and appealing hindu community to celebrate the ram mahotsav at grand level insiders however claimed with the date of ram temple inauguration scheduled on january 1 2024 the vhp leaders are leaving no stone unturned to celebrate the hindu new year known as varsh pratipada with full fervour vhp has also planned to connect more hindus to take part in the mahotsav celebrations and make it grand event

Title: unesco lu faculty to help develop unesco course
Article: lucknowfaculty member at education department of the lucknow university prof kiran lata dangwal has been selected asdeveloper of massive open online course mooc in unescointernational online mentoring programme the programme is designed to harness the potential of open education to achieve the united nations sustainable development goals dangwal will collaborate with kavita batra from haryana to develop mooc selection of our universityfaculty for the prestigous programme istestament to her outstanding scholarship research and commitment to education said lu spokesperson durgesh srivastava tnn

Title: trial in lakhimpur kheri violence case not slow paced says sc asks sessions court to apprise it of future developments
Article: new delhi the supreme court on tuesday said the trial in the 2021 lakhimpur kheri violence case in which union minister ajay kumar mishrason ashish is among those facing prosecution is not slow paced and directed the concerned sessions judge to keep apprising it about the future developments of the trial the top court observed though it is not monitoring the trial but it is having an indirect supervision on itbench of justices surya kant and jk maheshwari said the interim direction contained in its january 25 order by which it had granted eight week interim bail to ashish mishra in the case shall continue to operate advocate prashant bhushan representing the victim families told the bench that about 200 prosecution witnesses have to be examined and he is concerned about the slow pace of the trial the trial is not slow paced we have received three letters from the trial judge the bench observed adding it had gone through the contents of the letters received from the first additional district and sessions judge lakhimpur kheri the top court said as per the letters examination of three witnesses is over while cross examination of one of them is going on we are not using the word monitoring but we are having indirect supervision on the trial and we will do that it said adding let us continue with the same status for some more time on january 25 the apex court granted eight week interim bail to ashish mishra and directed him to leave uttar pradesh within one week of his release from jail on october 3 2021 eight people were killed in lakhimpur kheri districttikunia after violence erupted when farmers were protesting against the then deputy chief minister keshav prasad mauryavisit to the area according to the uttar pradesh police fir four farmers were mowed down by an suv in which ashish mishra was seated following the incident the driver of the suv and two bjp workers were allegedly lynched by angry farmersjournalist also died in the violence during the hearing on tuesday senior advocate mukul rohatgi appearing for ashish mishra told the bench at the outset that after the january 25 order his client was released from jail and he has appeared before the trial court on every date of hearing the bench said it has received letters from the trial judge and the proceedings are going on and witnesses are being examined the trial court shall continue to apprise this court of the future developments of the trial the bench said and posted the matter for hearing in may while hearing the matter on february 13 the apex court had said withview to ensure that trial proceedings can run smoothly and no impediment is caused by anyone it is directed that the accused persons and one family member of each victim complainant shall be permitted to attend the court proceedings along with their respective counsels in both the first information reports in its january 25 order the top court had exercised its suo moto constitutional powers and directed that four accused guruwinder singh kamaljeet singh gurupreet singh and vichitra singh who were arrested in connection withseparate fir lodged over the killing of three occupants of the suv which allegedly mowed down farmers there be released on interim bail till further orders while granting eight week interim bail to ashish mishra the bench said any attempt made by him his family or supporters to influence or threaten the witnesses directly or indirectly shall entail cancellation of interim bail it said ashish mishra shall surrender his passport to the trial court within one week of his release on interim bail and not enter uttar pradesh except to attend the trial proceedings the apex court also said he shall disclose the place of his residence to the trial court as well as the jurisdictional police station where he would stay during the period of interim bail the trial court shall send progress reports to this court after every date of hearing along with details of witnesses examined on each date the top court had said the lucknow bench of the allahabad high court on july 26 last year rejected ashish mishrabail plea he had challenged the high courtorder in the apex court on december 6 last year the trial court framed charges against ashish mishra and 12 others for the alleged offences of murder criminal conspiracy and other penal laws in the case of death of the four protesting farmers in lakhimpur kheri paving the way for the start of the trial

Title: uc trophy basketball jain university mop vaishnav emerge champions
Article: aluva jain university bangalore and mop vaishnav college chennai emerged champions in the menand womensections respectively in the uc trophy south zone inter collegiate basketball tournament here on friday jain university edged out sb college changanacherry 68 66 in the menfinal to claim the manorama trophy mop vaishnav beat srm university chennai 94 72 in their last league match to triumph with an all win record in the womensection they had earlier beaten jain university 74 64 jain university took the second spot withnarrow 44 43 victory over mar ivanios college thiruvananthapuram srm chennai finished third with their lone victory coming over mar ivanios 81 59 the results men final jain university 68 gautham 12 brijesh 10 bt sb college 66 prithin murali 18 aaron blessen 16 sharon 10 semifinals sb college 78 jinu devasia19 aaron blessen16 sharon11 anand 10 tom 10 bt srm 69 venkat18 viswak 14 mukesh 13 jain university 55 ashley 10 peter 10 bt mar ivanios 38 sajesh 10 women round robin league mop vaishnav college 94 sathya 30 sruthy 23 bt srm university 72 winnerpeter 19 sobhana 18 manisha 12 jain university 44 sarayu14 chandana 10 siya deodhar 10 bt mar ivanios krishna priya 14 ameesha jose10 mop vaishnav college 74 sruthy 21 nivetha 13 bt jain university 64 siya deodhar 21 nadmi 13 srm university 81 sobhana 19 winner 18 nitika 11 bt mar ivanios 59 sumra stanly 18 chinnu koshy 13 krishna priya 10

Title: jopposition parties to meet national leaders ec to seek statehood early assembly polls
Article: accusing the jammu and kashmir administration of allegedly bringing hardships to the people national conference president and ex chief minister farooq abdullah said saturday that all the opposition leaders from the union territory will visit delhi to seek support from the national leaders of various parties for restoration ofkstatehood he said this delegation will also meet the election commission to demand the conduct of early assembly elections ink afterthree hour long meeting withslew of opposition parties at his residence in jammu abdullah said their meeting discussed the prevailing situation in the ut and the ways and means to pull it out of its current morass deciding to meet the national leaders in delhi to seek their support in getting backkstatehood we wantpowerful statehood like other states in the country and not truncated statehood he said adding that they will also apprise the national leaders ofksituation so that it could be raised forcefully in parliament during the coming session we will also be meeting the election commission for early holding of assembly elections abdullah said pointing out that the assembly polls have not been held ink since 2014 despite the fact that there has beensupreme court ruling that the polls must be held within six months of dismissal of an elected government referring to the statements of prime minister narendra modi and union home minister amit shah that the situation ink was normal and thatmeeting of the20 nations will also be held in the valley in may abdullah asked why elections could not held then given suchsituation asked whether thek opposition delegation will also meet pm modi and shah during their delhi visit he said they will decide it only after meeting other national leaders thereafter we will meet again in jammu and also in kashmir before deciding our future course of action he said charging thatblacklisted company has been awarded the contract for conducting the computer based test cbt for selection of candidates for various government vacancies advertised by thek state services selection board jksssb the national conference chief also accused the ut government of allegedly committing atrocities on local youth who have been protesting against it on one hand they talk of rooting out corruption but the situation is before all of you they jksssb are giving contract toblacklisted company he said asking the administration why you are not disbanding it why it is necessary to go with that company abdullah also slammed the recent demolition drive by the administration across the ut especially when it could not provide employment he charged to the people you promised 50 000 jobs many years ago he asked the administration asking how many have been appointed so far advertisement cpileadery tarigamik congress president vikar rasool wani pdp leader amrik singh reen national panthers party leader harsh dev singh aam aadmi party aap leaders tony dogra sadar sabha president gulchain singh charak and shiv sena utb leader manish sahni were among the leaders who reportedly attended the meeting held by abdullah

Title: cyber police recover 100 stolen phones
Article: post by rk news on sunday march 12 2023 srinagar mar 11 cyber police in kashmir has geared up its task force and intensified efforts to curb online crimes in the valley on saturday the cyber wing informed that 100 mobile phones worth lakhs have been recovered and handed over to rightful owners intweet cyber police said cyber police kashmir recovers hundreds of lost missing cell phones worth lakhs of rupees which were handed over to rightful owners duringcybercrime awareness programme organized by cyber police station kashmir the cyber police in srinagar also organizedspecial cyber awareness program under the supervision of sp cyber ifhtikar talib at the cyber police station here the program was designed to provide attendees withcomprehensive understanding of various types of cybercrime including phishing identity theft and online fraud as the event drew toclose participants expressed their gratitude to the police for organizing such an informative and impactful program many pledged to take the lessons learned at the event and apply them in their daily lives helping to createsafer and more secure digital landscape for all

Title: chinazero covid response completely right highly effective chinanew premier li qiang
Article: beijing chinanew premier li qiang on monday strongly defended the much hated zero covid strategy followed by the country for over three years which hurt its economic growth also led to public protests saying the policy was completely right and delivered highly effective outcomes addressing his first press conference li said it took less than two months for chinahighly populous country to achievesmooth transition in covid 19 response and resume normal economic and social order which is indeed remarkable for over three years under the leadership of the communist party the chinese people have united in fighting covid 19 and now we have achievedmajor and decisive victory against the disease li said and avoided using the term zero covid china iscountry withlarge population and unbalanced development it took less than two months for it to achievesmooth transition in its response to the disease and to restore normal socioeconomic order it is indeedremarkable achievement li said he said chinacovid 19 strategy is completely right and its response is highly effective under the zero covid policy china completely insulated itself from the world for over three years and finally lifted it early this year resuming normal international travel links besides causing rare public protests including calls for chinese president xi jinping to quit the policy was largely attributed to the slowdown of the worldsecond largest economy to three per cent the slowest in decades the sudden lifting of restrictions in december last also causedmassive upsurge of omicron variant infections leading toheavy death toll especially among the unvaccinated elderly population but the government has not officially acknowledged it noting that there are still risks of virus transmission li said china will continue to follow the evolving epidemic situation and build up its capacity for early warning and forecast efforts will also be made to strengthen medical and health service systems at all levels speed up the development of new vaccines and medicines and keep communication and cooperation with the international community li added the coronavirus which first emerged in wuhan has turned intoglobal pandemic causing massive deaths and infections in all parts of the world

Title: loyola global leadership loyola global leadership award
Article: thiruvananthapuram president and ceo of fedex corporation rajesh subramaniam has won the loyola global leadership award instituted by the loyola old boys association loba thiruvananthapuram aravind mani co founder and ceo of riverstartup that manufactures electric utility vehicles has been chosen for the young achievers award of the association loba president renjith raveendran said the leadership awards aim to recognize outstanding leaders among the fraternity of old boys who can serve as role models for the new generation at loyola school loba had initiatedmedical insurance programme for around 120 loyola school staff members in 2015 andpension scheme for retired non teaching staff in 2018 both initiatives funded by the old boys of the school loba launched its annual global leadership awards in 2015

Title: crackdown on amritpal singh internet services suspended in punjab
Article: jalandhar all mobile internet sms and dongle services have been suspended in punjab till sunday asmassive manhunt is under way to arrest waris punjab de head amritpal singh so fartotal of 78 people have been arrested and several have been detained in connection with the crackdown launched against the chief of suspected pro khalistan outfit waris punjab de amritpal singh and his aides punjab police said on saturday adding that the khalistan sympathiser was still on the run the punjab chief secretary issued an order based onrequest from the punjab dgp who stated that certain sections posedthreat to public order and were inciting violence the order also noted that these sections frequently used social media platforms to disseminate inflammatory messages that served to incite mobs agitators and demonstrators as well as to mobilize their own manpower and resources for their anti national activities amritpal singh was being chased by police at noon in the shahkot neighbourhood of jalandhar and by the time he arrived in mehatpur his associates had already spread the word and made calls to the area the chase he was involved in was broadcasted live including footage from inside his own vehicle however internet access in the state was quickly disabled

Title: wala moose walaparents gifted car he designed
Article: ludhiana shubhdeep singh better known as sidhu moose wala was popular for his music in india and may parts of the world but hardly anyone knew that he wasbright student who was keenly interested in designing cars for the future on thursday the authorities and students of guru nanak dev engineering college the institute where moose wala studied gavebeautiful gift to his parents in the form of an electric car that was originally designed conceived and made by shubhdeep during his college days sidhuparents balkaur singh and charan kaur were the chief guests at the collegeannual day function on thursday chairman of cultural committee of gndec profs mann said sidhu was an alumnus of this college while pursuing btech electrical in 2015 shubhdeep had made the electric car under his project and has named it pb xi 5911 as his parents were coming here after several years and that too after losing their son all we wanted was to give thembeautiful memory of sidhu mann said the college authorities and students on thursday gifted this car to his parents the number displayed on this car is handwritten by moose wala hislove for 5911 tractor is visible in the design and name he added

Title: as cm sukhu goes about cancelling jai ram regime institutions congress bjp row hitsflashpoint
Article: the face off between the sukhvinder singh sukhu led congress government and the opposition bharatiya janata party bjp over the shutdown of institutions continues to rage even as the latter is looking to turn up the heat on the government on the issue last week the congress government ordered the closure of 19 degree colleges adding them to the list of an estimated over 900 government institutions and offices opened during the previous jai ram thakur led bjp regime that the sukhu dispensation has denotified since taking the reins of the hill state three months ago over the last few weeks the bjp has stepped up its protests against the sukhu government against its continuing bid to close such institutions calling it arbitrary and anti development on its part the government has justified its move as necessary in public interest on mondaybjp delegation led by leader of opposition in the himachal assembly jai ram thakur and state bjp chief suresh kashyap submittedmemorandum to the newly appointed governor shiv pratap shukla against the closure of these institutions according to the memorandum over 900 government institutions opened during the jai ram regime have been closed by the congress government so far significantly one of the first decisions that sukhu took after taking charge as the cm on december 11 last year was to shut down institutions and offices notified or upgraded after april 1 2022 these entities belonged to various government departments and organisations including the pwd power finance police booths schools and healthcare units among others the sukhu government argued that these government entities had been notified by the bjp government arbitrarily as part of vote bank politics just ahead of the november 2022 assembly polls without providing financial resources for their establishment and operation it charged that these institutions existed just on paper and that no recruitments were made for them advertisement this immediately erupted inrow between the two sides with the bjp targeting sukhu for allegedly playing vendetta politics at the cost of public interest citing the instance of the governmentlatest move to close 19 degree colleges the sukhu camp said that each of them had less than 60 students the government also said the teachers and students in these colleges will be transferred to nearby institutions it is embarrassing that bjp was only concerned with playing politics it came to our notice that one of the degree colleges had only 4 enrolments it was then decided that they need to be shut down because they did not serve any purpose except political purpose said naresh chauhan principal media advisor to the cm we have even allowed institutions that have at least 60 students to operate the interests of students are primary for us and we will ensure that the opportunities for them are maximised advertisement in the budget session of the state assembly that got underway tuesday the treasury and opposition benches are set to take on each other fiercely on the row hitting out at the sukhu government jai ram charged several institutions that had been running forlong time have been shut down this shows that the government is only concerned with settling political scores they are not understanding that there issense of anger and discontent among the public if there is no option people will come to the streets to protest we will raise their voice and several other issues in the session as well in state political circles the closure of the institutions has been attributed to cm sukhubid to take strong decisions on various issues the bjp has however called sukhuweak cm being allegedly controlled by the congress high command

Title: akalis smell vendetta as bail rejected for sukhbir badal in 2015 kotkapura firing case
Article: the court of the additional sessions judge faridkot on march 16 declined the anticipatory bail plea submitted by former punjab deputy chief minister sukhbir singh badal but granted it to former punjab chief minister parkash singh badal the court directed sukhbir to surrender before the illaqa duty magistrate within 15 days from the date of granting bail the badals had filed anticipatory bail applications in the case of the kotkapura firing incident of october 14 2015 which followed the incident of sacrilege on october 12 2015 in which torn pages of the sacred guru granth sahib from gurdwara burj jawahar singh wala were found on the streets of bargari village this followed successive incidents in whichguru granth sahib was stolen from the gurdwara on june 1 followed by another incident some months later in which posters with derogatory remarks about the sacred book were found pasted on the walls of bargari village on the intervening night of september 24 and september 25 the third incident on october 12 led to massive protests followed by heavy handed police action that has remainedpolitical issue in the state ever since police firing on that day in kotkapura alone had left around 60 people injured including over 30 cops the chargesheet was filed by an sit led by additional director general of police adgpk yadav on february 24 and march 6 mentioning all eight accused in the fir including the badals all of them have been issued notices to appear before the court of judicial magistrate first class ajaypal singh on march 23 the chief spokesperson of shiromani akali dal sad daljeet singh cheema said the party is exploring other legal options now that the bail application has been rejected we will approach the high court both the sad leadership and our supporters firmly believe that inclusion of the names of the former cm and his deputy in this fir is nothing but political vendetta by the ruling aam aadmi party aap but we have full faith in the judiciary and are sure this chargesheet too will face the same fate as that of the one earlier filed by former adgp kunwar vijay partap singh which was quashed by the punjab and haryana high court on april 9 2021 the counsel of the badals shiv kartar singh sekhon said statements of witnesses are the same as the ones in the reports of previous inquiries carried out by the justice zora singh commission the justice ranjit singh commission and the investigation by then adgp kunwar vijay partap singh the facts remain the same but they the sit under adgpk yadav have filednew report in their own way there is no new evidence against them the badals he added we are looking for further legal processes in sukhbircase and will pursue it accordingly the previous congress government had spent its five years in power harping on this sacrilege case rather than talking about development or other public issues now the aap government is doing the same thing justice needs to be ensured in the incident but indicting people for vendetta is unjustified said cheema advertisement even as the 2015 sacrilege and firing incidents continue to affect the political climate of the state since december 16 2021 an indefinite dharna has been going on at the site of the 2015 firing in behbal kalan from this site vidhan sabha speaker kultar singh sandhwan and cabinet minister kuldeep singh dhaliwal had separately announced around two months ago that the names of the badals would be added to the 2015 firing cases speaking about it cheema said when politicians make such claims even before the chargesheets are filed it shows that this is nothing but political vendetta let them do whatever they like they will also face the same fate as the congress in punjab sandhwan and dhaliwal had visited the dharna on different occasions to encourage the protesters to vacate the site the dharna was launched under the banner of bargari insaaf morcha by sukhraj singh niamiwala son of krishan bhagwan singh one of the two victims of the police firing at behbal kalan village that had followed hours after the firing at kotkapura on october 14 2015 to disperse another group of people blockingroad to protest the incidents of sacrilege advertisementchargesheet in the behbal kalan case will be filed soon dhaliwal had announced on march 4 while addressing protestors at the dharna site who hailed the decision to have the names of the badals added to the chargesheet they even organisedthanksgiving akhand path bhog in appreciation the same day and promised to vacate the site once the behbal kalan chargesheet is filed several sad leaders told the indian express these events are being used to target and harmpolitical party and its heads the public understands the motive of the ruling party hence we are not panickingleader added what else can be done now they have named the badals now we will fight it out this is on the same lines as the various other sits or inquiry commissions donmiss sad chief badal quizzed for 6 hours in 2015 kotkapura police firing case the sad is planning district level protest dharnas from march 17 against the ruling aap government over law and order and other governance issues the party was decimated in the 2022 assembly polls leaving it with only three seats in the sangrur lok sabha bypoll that followed sad camedistant fifth with even the bjp performing better than them the current series of events are happening with the jalandhar lok sabha bypoll due soon on the sacrilege incidents still haunting the party after seven years cheema said rival parties are playing politics over the issue rather than talking about facts and justice first the congress diverted punjab from the real issues facing the state now the aap is doing the same thing advertisement the kotkapura chargesheet indicts sad chief and then punjab dy cm sukhbir badal and then punjab police chief sumedh singh saini as masterminds ofconspiracy hatched for illegal and excess use of force to conceal inaction of state onseries of three sacrilege incidents sukhbir has claimed that he wasnpresent in the state on the day of the incident and had not contacted any police official the 7 000 page chargesheet filed in 17 parts also blames then cm parkash badal asfacilitator in executing the conspiracy it names several police officers including then ig param raj umranangal then dig amar singh chahal then faridkot ssp sukhmander singh mann and then ssp moga charanjit singh sharma for executing the conspiracy it also indicts then kotkapura sho gurdeep singh of distortion and concealment of facts

Title: fir hurting religious sentiments notice to pb on dera chiefplea against fir
Article: chandigarh the punjab and haryana high court has issued notice to the punjab government onplea filed by dera sacha sauda chief gurmeet ram rahim singh seeking cancellation of firs registered against him for hurting religious sentiments jalandhar police had booked him for his alleged objectionable comments on guru ravidas and sant kabir it is submitted that part of the sermon delivered in 2016 has been uploaded onyoutube channel in february 2023 which depicts the discourse given by the petitioner incompletely wrong context obviously the content is malicious and thus the fir deserves to be quashed justice sudhir mittal observed while recording the dera chiefcontention the matter has now been adjourned for may 30 for further hearing the hc has also soughtreply from jassi talan president sri guru ravidas tiger force punjab talhan patara jalandhar rural punjab who wascomplainant in this case the dera chief has sought directions for quashing the fir dated march 7 registered at police station patara jalandhar rural under section 295 hurting of religious sentiments as the same has been filed with ulterior motives and based on concealment and manipulation of facts it has been stated that the fir amounts to an abuse of the process of law as the facts alleged do not constitute an offence under section 295a ipc jitender khurana one of the counsels for the petitioners stated that the satsang was organized in 2016 there had been no complaint from any person in the past seven years some persons with vested interests picked upsmall portion of the satsang and uploaded the same onyoutube channel as alleged in the fir the petitioner or the dera has no concern with the youtube channel as alleged even the petitioner or the dera has not uploaded any video whatsoever alleged in the fir on youtube channel in february 2023 the mobile number through which the alleged video has been uploaded does not belong to the petitioner or the dera the hc was informed

Title: students ban entry of aap leaders seek grant promise
